com.allisonrodenbaugh.springboothelloworld

Class Customer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.allisonrodenbaugh.springboothelloworld.Customer

  • public class Customer
extends java.lang.Object

    Functionality for Bank Customers

    The Customer class implements the functionality that bank customers can chose through the controller's UI.

    Note: This class does not take user input directly but simply performs calculations/procedures that the user selected through the UI controller.

    Since:
    Fall 2018

      • addAccount

        public Account addAccount(float balance,
                          int accountType)
        Adds a new account to the system.
        Parameters:
        balance - the initial balance of the account. This will be a float number.
        accountType - the type of the account. This will be Checking or Savings
        Returns:
        Account object that was created

      • addLoan

        public Loan addLoan(float loanAmount,
                    java.lang.String loanType)
        Adds a new account to the system.
        Parameters:
        loanAmount - the initial balance of the account. This will be a float number.
        loanType - the type of the loan. This will be student, personal, auto, or business.
        Returns:
        the loan object that was created

      • printCustomer

        public void printCustomer()
        Prints the Customer attributes for user to view.

      • printAccountConfirmation

        public void printAccountConfirmation(Account account)
        Prints the Account attributes for user to view. This is displayed after adding new account.
        Parameters:
        account - the account object to print confirmation for.

      • printLoanConfirmation

        public void printLoanConfirmation(Loan loan)
        Prints the laon attributes for user to view. This is displayed after adding new loan.
        Parameters:
        loan - the loan object to print confirmation for.
